summary1.text: This article (30th Apr 2024) compares the BMW 5 Series (G60/G61, eighth generation, 2024) and BMW 7 Series (G70, seventh generation, 2022). The 5 Series has a wider, less vertical grille and a sleeker, more executive design, while the 7 Series has a prominent grille and a more limousine-like, blocky design. Both models offer fully electric (i5, i7) and plug-in hybrid versions. The 5 Series, like the 3 Series, is an executive saloon; the 7 Series is a limousine, often used for chauffeuring. Although both have similar boot sizes, the 7 Series offers more rear passenger space and luxury, especially with the 'Executive Pack' and BMW Theatre Screen (exclusive to 7 Series). While the 5 Series has the high-performance M5, the 7 Series has never had a full M version, but both have M60 xDrive and M70 xDrive options.

summary2.text: The BMW 5-Series and 7-Series are luxury sedans catering to different needs. The 5-Series (4,936 mm length, 1,868 mm width) balances luxury and sporty driving with engine options like a 208 horsepower 2.0-litre turbo (520i) and a 449 horsepower 4.4-litre V8 (M550i xDrive), offering responsive steering and agile handling. The 7-Series (5,260 mm length, 1,902 mm width) prioritizes comfort, technology, and prestige with a smoother ride; base model 740i featuring a 335 horsepower 3.0-litre turbocharged inline-six engine, and the 760i xDrive featuring a 6.6-litre V12 engine.

| Handling | Responsive steering and agile handling | Smoother ride focused on comfort |
